alert.note: Alert for Baker; Decatur; Grady; Miller; Mitchell; Seminole; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 30 at 8:44AM EST until November 30 at 9:45AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Jackson County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northeastern Washington County in the Panhandle of Florida... Decatur County in southwestern Georgia... Grady County in southwestern Georgia... Southeastern Miller County in southwestern Georgia... Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia... Baker County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Thomas County in south central Georgia... Seminole County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 945 AM EST/845 AM CST/. * At 844 AM EST/744 AM CST/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Newton to 10 miles north of West Bainbridge to 6 miles southeast of Donalsonville to 17 miles northwest of Chattahoochee to near Marianna to 8 miles east of Chipley, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Newton, Pelham, Marianna, Chipley, Bainbridge, Donalsonville, Cairo, Camilla, Baconton, Whigham, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Cottondale, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Alford, Attapulgus, Sale City and Iron City. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
